comments.html:
If Service Provider is willing to cooperate, DSCP marking can be used for QoS policies on provider PE routers. This relies on copying of DSCP bits from inner IP header to GRE header, and then to outer IP header. If SP is not willing to help, then there's not much you can do.

Interesting idea would be to implement plain RSVP for bandwidth reservation over DMVPN...
comments.name: Sinisa

comments.html:
RSVP-over-DMVPN helps only if you strictly enforce it (not sure you can do that with IOS). Otherwise definitely an interesting idea.

RSVP-under-DMVPN doesn't scale.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: Heh, I was wondering the reason for the sudden spike in traffic!  :)
comments.name: Jared

comments.html: Your article is still the best description of inbound QoS challenges I found ;) Thanks again for writing it!
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html:
I am working on the transport network, we have 3 options:
A first is CEoDWDM, where architecture consists of carrier Ethernet switch/routers (CESRs) with connection-oriented Ethernet (COE), which can be combined with a separate WDM layer
A second Pure IPoDWDM is integrated transponders on Layer 3 routers, typically referred to as IP over DWDM (IPoDWDM)
And 3rd is Hybrid
comments.name: Rajat Bansal
